definition: quickly and without warning, tending to crumble or break into flakes due to a large amount of shortening, the fielding position of the player on a baseball team who is stationed between second and third base, create a short circuit in
details:
adverb
- quickly and without warning
= synonyms: abruptly
- in a curt, abrupt and discourteous manner
= synonyms: shortly
- at a disadvantage
= example: at a disadvantage
= synonyms: unawares
- so as to interrupt
= example: so as to interrupt
- at some point or distance before a goal is reached
= example: at some point or distance before a goal is reached
- clean across
= example: clean across
- without possessing something at the time it is contractually sold
= example: without possessing something at the time it is contractually sold
adjective
- tending to crumble or break into flakes due to a large amount of shortening
= example: tending to crumble or break into flakes due to a large amount of shortening
- (primarily spatial sense) having little length or lacking in length
= example: (primarily spatial sense) having little length or lacking in length
- primarily temporal sense
= synonyms: long
- of speech sounds or syllables of relatively short duration
= example: of speech sounds or syllables of relatively short duration
- not holding securities or commodities that one sells in expectation of a fall in prices
= example: not holding securities or commodities that one sells in expectation of a fall in prices
- lacking foresight or scope
= example: lacking foresight or scope
= synonyms: shortsighted, unforesightful, myopic
- (of memory) deficient in retentiveness or range
= example: (of memory) deficient in retentiveness or range
= synonyms: forgetful, unretentive
- not sufficient to meet a need
= synonyms: inadequate, poor
- less than the correct or legal or full amount often deliberately so
= synonyms: light, scant
- low in stature
= synonyms: little
- marked by rude or peremptory shortness
= synonyms: curt
noun
- the fielding position of the player on a baseball team who is stationed between second and third base
= synonyms: shortstop
- the location on a baseball field where the shortstop is stationed
- accidental contact between two points in an electric circuit that have a potential difference
= synonyms: short circuit
verb
- create a short circuit in
= synonyms: short-circuit
- cheat someone by not returning him enough money
= synonyms: short-change
